poem:
### Foundations of Knowledge

The league table stands,  
a monument to ambition;  
columns of numbers built  
on dreams. But dig deeper—  
between the mortar of rivalry,  
where the heart of learning rests,  
humble, unseen, yet enduring—  
an edifice to weather  
the storm of time's critique,  
where true engineers dwell.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Best UK universities for civil engineering – league table default". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Best UK universities for civil engineering – league table default
